alert.note: Alert for Geary; Morris; Riley; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 11:09PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Geary, southeastern Riley, Morris, western Wabaunsee and southeastern Pottawatomie Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1108 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Grandview Plaza to 5 miles southeast of Burdick. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wamego, Council Grove, Alma, White City, Alta Vista, Dwight, McFarland, Belvue, Wilsey, Parkerville, Dunlap, Council Grove Lake and Volland. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 311 and 333. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
